page.title: 04THE OLD COATES SCHOOL
page.content: The old{Coates Endowed Middle School building is situated at the corner of where North Road and Main Road meet. The engraving on the side of the building reads: 'Ponteland School Endowed by{Richard Coates}Anno Domini 1719 rebuilt 1831.' When Richard Coates died he left the income from eleven houses and a Smithy in trust to pay annuites to his wife and sister, the remainder to be used as the erection of a single storyed school in{Ponteland. Pupils atending the school were supplied with clothing consisting of grey coats and caps for boys, maneux and petticoats for girls.Children began at the age of seven and finished at the age of eleven. Now it is owned by{Glover and Humble who use it as an estate agent.
